title: UAB: Player arrested after stabbing 2 teammates
content: A UAB football player was arrested after stabbing two of his teammates Saturday morning at the football facility ahead of the Blazers' home game against USF, a school spokesperson confirmed.

title: Shanahan hopeful but admits Aiyuk case 'unusual'
content: Niners coach Kyle Shanahan alternated between offering insight and declining to provide specifics on wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk's status with the team, a situation that he characterized as "extremely unusual."

title: Manning makes Texas history after snagging TD
content: Arch Manning became the first Longhorns player to catch, throw and rush for a touchdown on a night in which he accounted for six scores.

title: Vandy's Pavia makes Heisman case in career day
content: Diego Pavia threw for a career-high 484 yards and five touchdowns and No. 14 Vanderbilt beat Kentucky 45-17 Saturday to keep its CFP hopes alive.

title: Haney becomes 3-division champ in dominant win
content: Devin Haney rolled to an emphatic win over Brian Norman Jr. to capture the WBO welterweight crown Saturday, giving him a title in his third division.

title: Harden hangs 55 on Hornets to set Clips record
content: Clippers star James Harden set a franchise record with 55 points in Saturday's win over the Hornets; it was the 25th 50-point game of his career.

title: NC State's bizarre punt recovery and a salute to a surgeon headline college football Week 13 superlatives
content: A Wolfpack punter somehow recovered his own punt, which easily made this week's college football superlatives.

title: Final prep for NFL Week 12: We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Will the Browns lean on the run in Shedeur Sanders' first start? Will Eagles-Cowboys come down to Jalen Hurts? Is Michael Wilson startable in fantasy?

title: Chelsea pass Burnley test, but Barcelona and Arsenal await in a big week
content: Chelsea weren't at their best vs. Burnley and got an important win, but they will need a bit more when facing Barcelona and Arsenal next.

title: Liverpool ratings: Isak, Konaté get 3/10 in woeful Forest loss
content: Liverpool were thrashed at Anfield by Nottingham Forest, and they were poor at both ends of the pitch.

title: Videos show police search for Marshawn Kneeland before death
content: The Texas DPS released hours of video footage that details their search for Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland before he was found dead.

title: Buzz: A closer look at what to make of Bengals not activating Joe Burrow for Week 12
content: Joe Burrow won't be activated for Sunday against the Patriots, but Stephania Bell explains that there's reason to believe the Bengals QB remains on track to return on Thanksgiving.

title: Inside the art of blocking a kick in the NFL: 'They're game changers'
content: The league has seen an uptick in blocked kicks, and ESPN's NFL Nation shares how players have done it.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Late-night drama unfolds in the West
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continued group play Friday. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: NBA first-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Tim Bontemps takes the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, the potential post-Trae Hawks and more first-month standout storylines.

title: Pete Alonso's three most aggressive suitors so far -- and a few other fits for the free agent first baseman
content: For a second straight winter, the Mets' franchise home run king is seeking a long-term deal. Where might he land?

title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: WNBA mock draft: There's a new No. 1 replacing Lauren Betts at the top
content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern eye move for Vasco's Rayan
content: Bayern are reportedly looking to sign Vasco da Gama forward Rayan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, each team's quarter-season MVP
content: The Avalanche's reign atop the list continues, and the Blackhawks break into the top 10. Here's the full list.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

title: Centre's Bill To Allow President To Frame Norms For Chandigarh Sparks Row
content: The Centre has proposed to include the Union territory of Chandigarh under the ambit of Article 240 of the Constitution, which empowers the president to make regulations for the UT and legislate directly.

title: Controversy Erupts Over Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir's 'Babri Masjid' Remark
content: A major political controversy has broken out after Trinamool Congress MLA Humayun Kabir declared that he would lay the foundation stone of a 'Babri Masjid' on December 6 in Beldanga, Murshidabad district.

title: Siddaramaiah Meets Kharge, Dismisses Karnataka Leadership Change Speculation
content: Amid an ongoing power tussle in the ruling Congress, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday called on party president Mallikarjun Kharge at his residence here, and dismissed speculation of a leadership change in the state.

title: Large Quantity Of Explosives Found Near School In Uttarakhand's Almora
content: A large quantity of highly explosive gelatin sticks has been found near a school in a village in Uttarakhand, putting the police on alert in the Almora district.

title: "Nothing I Can Do": John F Kennedy's Granddaughter On Terminal Cancer Diagnosis
content: Tatiana Schlossberg, the daughter of Kennedy's daughter, Caroline Kennedy, and Edwin Schlossberg, said she was diagnosed in May 2024 at 34.

title: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Dissolves All Organisational Units After Bihar Poll Drubbing
content: The Jan Suraaj Party failed to open its account in the Bihar assembly polls, with most of its candidates losing their deposits.

title: Few Jackals Escape From Delhi Zoo Enclosure, Search Teams Deployed
content: A few jackals escaped from their enclosure at Delhi's National Zoological Park on Saturday morning, prompting authorities to launch a search operation in the forested area behind the animal exhibits, according to an official.

title: Meta Buried 'Casual' Evidence Of Social Media Harm: US Court Filings
content: The allegation of Meta burying evidence of social media harms is just one of many in a late Friday filing by Motley Rice, a law firm suing Meta, Google, TikTok and Snapchat on behalf of school districts around the country.

title: "Long Live The Friendship Between India, France": Macron On Meeting PM Modi
content: Following his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the sidelines of the 2025 G20 Summit in Johannesburg, French President Emmanuel Macron expressed gratitude and reaffirmed the strength of India-France relations.

title: "Nowhere Else To Go": Shubhanshu Shukla Calls For Tackling Climate Crisis
content: Astronaut and Air Force Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla on Saturday urged the youth to work together to tackle shared global challenges like climate change, and avoid making the mistakes of earth in space.

title: Speeding Car Driven By Minor Runs Over 8-Year-Old Boy In Gurugram: Cops
content: An eight-year-old boy was killed after being mowed down by a car here, police said on Saturday. The car which was also being driven by a minor dragged the child for around 20 meters before coming to a halt, a police officer said.

title: Ukraine Peace Plan "Not Final Offer", Says Trump After Giving A Deadline
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has reacted coolly to the plan, saying he would propose "alternatives."

title: Donald Trump Says He Has One Thing In Common With Zohran Mamdani
content: US President Donald Trump hosted New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani in the Oval Office on Friday, after the administration had repeatedly referred to the left-wing incoming mayor as a "communist".

title: PM Modi Announces New Trilateral Partnership With Australia, Canada
content: A new trilateral technology and innovation partnership between India, Australia and Canada was announced by PM Modi after a meeting with his Australian and Canadian counterparts on the sidelines of the G20 Leaders' Summit

title: 'You Have Votes, I Have Funds': Ajit Pawar's 'Threat' To Voters In Malegaon
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar set the cat among the pigeons while campaigning for local elections when he appeared to threaten voters, saying he would release funds he had promised only if all of his party's candidates were elected.

title: Ex-Brazilian President Bolsonaro Arrested Over Flight Risk
content: Brazil's federal police on Saturday arrested former president Jair Bolsonaro over suspicion he was plotting to escape and avoid starting a 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.

title: 21 Dead In Gaza As Israel, Hamas Trade Truce Violation Allegations
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said 21 people were killed and dozens more wounded in multiple Israeli air strikes on Saturday, as Hamas and Israel again traded allegations of violating the fragile ceasefire.

title: Mossad's Big Claim: Hamas Terror Network In Europe For "On-Command" Attacks
content: Israel's Mossad intelligence service has publicly alleged that Hamas has been cultivating an operational network across Europe, working through covert cells.

title: PM Proposes 6 New Initiatives At G20, Says Indian Values Can Drive Progress
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has proposed four new initiatives aimed at global development at the G20 Leaders' Summit in Johannesburg.

title: 37 Maoists, Including Senior Leaders And Young Women, Surrender In Telangana
content: The Maoist movement suffered a significant organisational setback on Saturday as 37 of its underground cadre, including top state committee members and a large contingent of young women, surrendered in Hyderabad.

title: YSRCP misleading public over VSP issue, says Minister
content: With the initiative of the Chandrababu Naidu government, the Centre had announced ₹11,400-crore package for the steel plant, says Srinivas

title: India offers ‘strong support’ to Brazil for COP30, says satisfied with many outcomes from summit
content: Though New Delhi expressed satisfaction with many decisions, it did not specifically call the COP30 a success in devising a policy aimed at preventing climate change issues

title: Parents write to V-C, seek clarity regarding future of their children studying at Al Falah University
content: Around 18 parents visited the university campus on Saturday and submitted the letter expressing concern over the future of the university

title: Tamil Nadu expands Naan Mudhalvan initiative to healthcare
content: As part of this new initiative, students will receive specialised training in communication skills and digital skills — two competencies increasingly critical in today’s clinical environments

title: Dust to dust
content: Wells have gone dry and dust forms a thick coat over nearly every surface in the once sylvan landscape of Uthiramerur in Kancheepuram; quarries and stone crushing units are slowly eroding quality of life and leaving the residents in a belt of 60 villages in distress. Deepa H. Ramakrishnan and Geetha Srimathi record the tragic transformation of Uthiramerur

title: BJP criticises T.N. Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin for calling Sanskrit a ‘dead language’
content: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said that the DMK leader had “become synonymous with anarchy and division” and alleged that T.N. Deputy Chief Minister was “known for his hatred” for Hindus

title: Devotees barred from climbing Arunachala Hills in Tiruvannamalai for Maha Deepam festival
content: Officials say that the safety of climbers was taken into consideration as the terrain on the hills was still wet; this will be the second year to ban devotees from climbing the hills on Maha Deepam day

title: CAG urges trainee civil servants to play transformative role
content: The  Comptroller and Auditor General of India, Sanjay Murthy explained how data-driven governance enhances institutional accountability and improvement and underscored the need for strong institutional financial discipline and investment-readiness

title: Congress appoints Vinay Kumar as new Himachal PCC chief
content: The appointment had been held up for quite some time and the hill state did not have a Pradesh Congress Committee after the previous committee headed by Kuldeep Singh was dissolved on November 6 last year

title: In the name of the cow | Maharashtra’s cow vigilantes fuel fear among meat traders, cattle rearers
content: In a Mumbai chawl, a woman waits for her missing husband. In Nashik, a man is allegedly bludgeoned to death. In Ahilyanagar, a child ends his life after he is allegedly humiliated in a live-streamed video

title: CPI (Maoist) | The guns fall silent
content: The killing of Madvi Hidma, the elusive commander of the Central Military Commission of the Maoists, signals not just a tactical defeat of the insurgents but the effective collapse of the armed struggle that once threatened to engulf vast swathes of India’s forested heartland

title: Are e-KYC norms excluding MGNREGA workers? | Explained
content: Why is the Union government pushing e-KYC verification of workers who are employed under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act? Was there no method of verification available before the e-KYC system? What is the National Mobile Monitoring System?

title: Battle for the ballot a burden on the pocket
content: Though the State Election Commission has set a ceiling of ₹1.5 lakh as election expenses for candidates in district panchayats and Corporations, the real cost overshoots the limit by a huge margin. Parties bear a portion of the expenses, but the candidate has to shoulder the actual burden

title: Munnar hopes for stability after a term of defections, power struggle
content: Grama panchayat sees five different presidents in the past five years. Though UDF won the poll in 2020 with 11 seats and LDF 10 seats, two of its members defected to the in 2022 bringing the panchayat under LDF control. The was followed by a series of defections and power struggle

title: Student leaders give a campus vibe for local body elections in Kerala
content: CPI(M) has fielded 48 leaders of Students Federation of India  in the polls while the Congress has found 79 candidates from the Kerala Students’ Union. MSF, the students’ union of the Indian Union Muslim League has fielded 47 leaders, while 14 from the All India Students’ Federation, the CPI’s student wing, are also in the fray

title: Tamil Nadu government finds itself in a tight corner over Code on Social Security
content: The concern expressed by activists and trade unionists, besides the State government, is that the present framework of welfare schemes for unorganised workers may get disturbed after implementation of the Labour Code

title: Had there been Operation Sindoor after 26/11, nobody would have dared to attack India: CM Fadnavis
content: Speaking at an event at the Gateway of India to mark the 17th anniversary of the 26/11 attack that is coming up, the Maharashtra CM says an attack on the city was an “attack on the sovereignty of the country”

title: Adversary making desperate attempts to disrupt peace: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha
content: He said the Army contributed in creating a conducive environment for sustainable peace and overall development of the J&K U.T. as well as the growth of our country

title: Congress appoints new DCC presidents
content: Congress appoints new District Congress Committee presidents, including five MLAs and five women, enhancing leadership across districts

title: Cong., AAP, Akalis oppose Chandigarh plan of Central govt.
content: The parties say Constitution amendment Bill planned for Parliament’s upcoming Winter Session is a ploy to snatch the city away from Punjab

title: Advocates’ bodies seek probe by High Court judge into killing of Maoists
content: APSAA and Bezawada Bar Association allege that Maoist leader Madvi Hidma was killed in a ‘fake encounter’; human rights leader calls it a ‘murder’

title: Shashi Tharoor praises Trump-Mamdani meet; BJP takes a jibe at Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress MP, posting a video of the meeting on X, said once elections are over, learn to cooperate with each other in the common interests of the nation. In response, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla says once again Shashi Tharoor ‘reminds Congress to put India First not Parivar’

title: Kadamakudy shocker for Congress as candidate’s nomination gets rejected
content: The nomination papers filed by Elsy George was rejected after it was found that a person who had seconded her candidature was a voter outside the division

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) rebukes Congress, says they don’t need anybody’s permission on MNS alliance
content: Parties within the Maha Vikas Aghadi bloc are divided over allying with Raj Thackeray’s MNS in the upcoming local body election

title: Pune cops bust arms-making units in M.P. village; 47 detained
content: The raid was conducted by a 105-member team comprising personnel from the crime branch and officials of wireless, drone, surveillance, and cyber sections

title: Madhya Pradesh HC grants interim stay on action against ancestral house of Al-Falah group chairperson
content: The Mhow Cantonment Board issued a notice on November 19 to remove "unauthorised construction" at the ancestral house of Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui.

title: Nomination of transpersons to contest from women’s wards accepted
content: The candidatures of Amaya Prasad and Arunima M. Kurup, fielded by the UDF in Thiruvananthapuram and Alappuzha respectively, were approved by the respective returning officers on November 22, 2025, thus paving the way for them to contest the civic polls

title: West Bengal SIR will cause the largest disenfranchisement of voters in history: activists
content: Political analysts, activists say SIR being used as a tool to “reduce the electoral weight of the States where the BJP is not sure of its support”; claim it is a “backdoor entry” for the controversial NRC, CAA

title: Security in Srinagar improving, all measures in place to maintain peace: CRPF IG
content: The CRPF, along with the J&K Police, the Army and civil administration, is working jointly to ensure stability in the region, says Pawan Kumar Sharma

title: Watch: Sons, daughters and battle for political legacy: the Lalu Yadav family fallout
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will examine the gender angle in political parties with family legacies

title: Siddaramaiah meets Kharge on resolving impasse over Cabinet reshuffle, power sharing
content: There was no clarity on the outcome of the talks; Shivakumar too is expected to meet Kharge on Sunday

title: New labour codes lead to confusion over Karnataka’s minimum wage revision
content: The revision of minimum wages in Karnataka, last notified in 2017-2018, is overdue since revision has to be done once in at least five years. A draft on revision was issued in April, 2025

title: After poll drubbing, Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party dissolves all organisational units
content: In a statement, party spokesperson Syed Masih Uddin said new units will be formed in the next one and a half months.

title: How a police constable turned into a key conspirator in ATM cash van looting case
content: On the day of the incident, Annappa showed up at one of the checkposts that were set up to check vehicles, despite having no duty there

title: Parliament Winter Session: Bill on civil nuclear sector among 10 proposed legislations
content: A Bill that proposes to open up the nuclear sector for private players has been listed for introduction

title: Light to moderate rain likely in Rayalaseema as low-pressure area forms in the Bay
content: More time needed to get clarity on whether the depression would intensify into a cyclone, says IMD-Amaravati official

title: Money laundering: eight trusts with PFI links under ED scanner
content: Properties worth ₹67 crore were recently attached as part of an intensified investigation into the role of these trusts in  handling funds for the banned Popular Front of India

title: CJI-designate identifies chipping away at 90,000-strong arrears in Supreme Court as his first priority
content: Justice Surya Kant, in an informal interaction, said identification of core cases and forming Constitution Benches to decide them will also release thousands of other connected cases

title: Integrate service with professional excellence, Vice-President exhorts students
content: Sri Sathya Sai Institute of Higher Learning is a national model for its thrust on character building, discipline, spiritual grounding, and commitment to providing free education, says C.P. Radhakrishnan

title: Cruise season kicks off amid hopes of revival
content: A new addition to this year’s package tours is Kadamakkudy, which is fast emerging as one of the sought-after tourist destinations in Kochi

title: Uttarakhand on alert: 20kg explosives, 161 gelignite sticks found near Almora schools; key details
content: A significant security alert was issued in Almora district after 161 gelignite sticks and over 20 kg of explosives were discovered near two schools. The discovery, made by children, has prompted a massive search operation involving dog squads and forensic teams to identify the source and purpose of the material.

title: Delhi blast: Accused doctors bought Russian weapon, freezer for explosives
content: Fresh revelations in the Jaish-e-Mohammed module bust in Faridabad expose a sophisticated weapons and explosives network. Dr. Muzammil purchased a Russian assault rifle for Rs 5 lakh, later recovered from Dr. Adeel's locker. Dr. Shaheen arranged for weapons and a freezer, with funds largely mobilized by her. The module's operational readiness and planning are highlighted by these discoveries.

title: US arrests tech company CTO for exporting Nvidia's banned chips to China
content: Four individuals, including two American citizens and two PRC nationals residing in the U.S., have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork and using a shell company to transship the sensitive technology, which has AI and military applications. The scheme aimed to circumvent U.S. export controls, with over $3.

title: Ind vs Sa: KL Rahul set to return as India’s ODI captain; Gill doubtful for T20Is as well
content: KL Rahul will captain India in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, replacing Shubman Gill who is out with a serious neck injury. With vice-captain Shreyas Iyer also sidelined, Rahul steps in. Gill's recovery timeline is extended, raising doubts about his availability for the T20Is as well.

title: 'Too much speed for narrow lane': Teen-driven car kills 7-year-old in Gurgaon
content: A seven-year-old boy was tragically killed after being struck and dragged by a speeding car driven by a 15-year-old in Gurgaon's Maruti Kunj. The incident occurred while the child was playing outside his home with his father. Police have registered a case of causing death by negligence and rash driving.

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
content: A viral AI-generated image of tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg in a parking lot has captivated the internet. Dubbed the '$1 trillion squad,' the photo's cinematic style and the juxtaposition with a cheap motel room in a sequel image fueled a massive meme storm, reflecting 2025's AI-dominated landscape and the immense cultural power of tech leaders.

title: Ukraine peace plan row: Is Trump’s 28-point proposal actually Russia’s ‘wishlist’? What Rubio said
content: The US State Department has vehemently denied that a 28-point Ukraine peace plan is a "Russian wish list," despite claims from senators. Spokesman Tommy Pigott stated the plan was US-authored with input from both nations. Leaked details suggest the proposal reflects Russian demands, causing concern in Kyiv and Europe. President Trump has urged Ukraine's response.

title: Exclusive! Abhinav Tejrana - The Delhi boy ignored by DDCA is making waves for Goa
content: The 24-year-old top-order batter Abhinav Tejrana has set the Ranji Trophy on fire. Batting for Goa at No. 3, the Delhi-born cricketer has amassed 651 runs in eight innings, including a double century on first-class debut against Chandigarh. He has also smashed two centuries against Punjab and Saurashtra, and not to forget his match-saving unbeaten 73 against Karnataka.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google’s AI success can create…
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements could create temporary challenges but expresses confidence in OpenAI's ability to lead the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, the company is focusing on superintelligence and strengthening its US-based AI infrastructure through a partnership with Foxconn.

title: 'Trusted orchestra': Army chief on Op Sindoor's 22-min, 9-target strike
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi described Operation Sindoor as a "trusted orchestra" where forces destroyed nine terror targets in 22 minutes. He highlighted the operation's success, emphasizing the importance of pre-visualization and team trust in swift decision-making. Dwivedi also hinted at a potential "2.0 version" of the operation.

title: 'Long live friendship': Macron hails India-France ties; meets PM Modi on G20 sidelines
content: French President Emmanuel Macron and Prime Minister Narendra Modi met at the Johannesburg G20 Summit, reaffirming their strong bilateral partnership. Modi also addressed the growing threat of natural disasters, advocating for enhanced international cooperation and proposing a G20 Open Satellite Data Partnership to aid the Global South.

title: Stefon Diggs' lady love Cardi B raves about hospital stay after giving birth
content: Rapper Cardi B shared her positive hospital experience after giving birth. She praised the food and treatment, joking about getting pregnant again soon. Fans reacted to her comments online. Cardi B is preparing for her upcoming tour in February 2026. Her album 'Am I The Drama' was released on September 19.

title: Historic! First time since the 19th century: Perth Test breaks century-old records
content: Australia thrashed England by eight wickets in the first Ashes Test, concluding in under two days. England's batting collapsed spectacularly, facing their fewest balls in a Test since 1904. The match was the shortest Ashes contest by balls bowled in over a century, with Travis Head smashing a rapid century to seal the dominant victory.

title: When Madhuri recalled her fearless first date with Dr Nene
content: Bollywood icon Madhuri Dixit Nene revealed her nervousness during her first date with husband Dr. Shriram Nene, a mountain-biking adventure she'd never attempted.  Despite her fear, Dr. Nene admired her bravery, a moment that marked their natural connection. The couple recently celebrated 26 years of marriage, reflecting on their journey together.

title: 'Brainless': 85-year-old ex-England cricketer blasts Ben Stokes-led team
content: Legendary cricketer Geoffrey Boycott has slammed England's "brainless" batting and bowling after their swift Ashes Test defeat. He criticized their repeated mistakes and inability to learn, stating it's impossible to take the team seriously. Despite a strong position, England self-destructed, allowing Australia to chase a modest target with ease, highlighting the pitfalls of their aggressive approach against top sides.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in red leather on date with Patrick before Chiefs–Colts game
content: Patrick Mahomes and the Chiefs face a crucial home game against the Colts, needing a win to boost playoff hopes after two road losses. Off the field, Mahomes shared a personal moment with his wife, Brittany, enjoying a night out at their steakhouse, 1587 Prime, highlighting their connection amidst the NFL season's pressures.

title: Ciara on Russell Wilson: His maturity and 'fullness as a man' define their marriage
content: Singer Ciara revealed on the 'Angie Martinez IRL' podcast that her husband, Russell Wilson, despite being younger, acts as an emotional anchor due to his 'old soul' and maturity. She finds his grounded demeanor provides stability amidst NFL pressures and fame.  Ciara emphasized his 'fullness as a man' enriches their strong partnership.

title: Exercises, yoga positions to bring down Uric Acid levels naturally
content: High-intensity exercise sessions, that extend beyond moderate levels should we avoided, since they produce lactic acid, which hinders uric acid elimination from the body. The management of uric acid levels requires people to perform exercises at moderate and low intensity levels. Let's take a look at specific exercises that help in reducing uric acid

title: Smriti & Palaash groove to Salman's 'Tenu Le Ke Main Jawanga' at sangeet ceremony
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palaash Muchhal are all set to tie the knot on November 23, and their pre-wedding festivities are already creating a buzz online. After their haldi ceremony went viral, new photos and videos from the mehendi and sangeet events have taken over social media, delighting fans and followers.

title: Toronto Maple Leafs Captain Auston Matthews to miss his fifth consecutive game
content: Toronto Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews will miss his fifth consecutive game. He is recovering from a lower-body injury. Matthews participated in the morning skate, showing recovery progress. However, he will not play against the Montreal Canadiens. Teammate Matthew Knies also remains sidelined with a similar injury. The team is being cautious with their injured players.

title: Heart health: 3 morning drinks that can reduce blood pressure
content: The relaxing properties of hibiscus tea, help blood vessels stay open while preventing their constriction which increases blood pressure. The anti-inflammatory compounds in hibiscus tea, work to protect cardiovascular health. The morning consumption of freshly brewed hibiscus tea, provides a relaxing method to handle blood pressure issues naturally

title: Israel strikes Hamas targets: Airstrikes launched on Gaza; over 20 killed
content: Israel launched airstrikes in Gaza, killing five senior Hamas members and 24 Palestinians, including children, following reported gunfire at Israeli troops. These strikes occurred shortly after the UN Security Council approved a US-backed plan for Gaza's security and governance, which includes an international stabilization force.

title: Pakistan behind Delhi car blast? CM Fadnavis says plan was to bomb 'every corner of India'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis stated Pakistan, unable to win a direct fight, attempts to assert presence through proxy wars, citing the Delhi explosion. Fadnavis also said that had the previous government taken action like PM Modi-approved Operation Sindoor, the country would not have suffered terror attacks like Pahalgam, where 26 civilians were killed in Baisaran meadow.

title: 'Detention centres in every district': CM Yogi cracksdown on 'infiltrators'; what's the plan?
content: Uttar Pradesh's chief minister, Yogi Adityanath, has directed district officials to crack down hard on anyone illegally residing in the state, stressing the importance of maintaining order and safeguarding national security. Plans are in motion to set up temporary holding facilities for these identified individuals while arrangements for their removal are made.

title: Riley Gaines fires back after Pablo Torre claims she made money from advocacy
content: Riley Gaines has vehemently denied claims of profiting from her advocacy, dismissing a report detailing speaking fees and leadership center earnings as a "baseless hit piece." Gaines, currently focused on her newborn, stated she's busy and unbothered by the allegations, asserting her stance on protecting women's sports is on the "right side of history."

title: Stephen Curry’s wife Ayesha admits marriage challenges amid hectic lifestyle
content: Ayesha Curry's recent statements on a podcast have stirred controversy. She revealed she did not initially want marriage or children, but found herself pregnant soon after marrying Stephen Curry. This comes after she previously discussed prioritizing their marriage amidst busy schedules. Fans have reacted negatively to her confessions, despite the couple's long-standing commitment.

title: Define 'online grooming' in Pocso law: NCW
content: the protection of children from sexual offences (POCSO) Act does not address 'online grooming' explicitly, the national commission for women has recommended that a new clause be introduced in the law to clearly define it . the fine to be imposed on the offender should not be less than Rs 15 lakh .

title: Op Pathshala: J&K police interact with Darul-Uloom students in Ganderbal
content: senior police officers interacted with students and faculty of darul Uloom . officials briefed students about "various harmful influences that can mislead youth," urging them to make informed and responsible choices . police reiterated their commitment to fosteria .

title: ‘G-force blackout’: What experts said on Tejas Dubai crash; visuals show jet plunge
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Only 4 palliative-care centres for every 10 millon Indians, says research
content: Representative image Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. Over the years, she has worked in Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh and West UP, gaining diverse on-ground experience that shapes her storytelling. Read More

title: Another Bengal BLO dead, suicide note blames SIR
content: at least six suicides by BLOs have been reported from five states . the 51-year-old para-teacher left behind a suicide note in her home . she held EC responsible for her death . EC to launch SIR in 12 states and UTs in Phase 2 .

title: IAF officer sent to Dubai to be part of Tejas crash probe
content: the IAF officer will be "a member in attendance" at the inquiry . the ill-fated jet's flight data recorder or "black box" is expected to provide key information about the cause of the crash . a pilot's mortal remains were brought back to Tamil Nadu on an IAF C-130J .

title: COP30 ends agrees to triple adaptation funds but fails on fossil fuels phase-out roadmap
content: Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at The Times of India. He writes on environment, climate change, agriculture, water resources and clean energy, tracking policy issues and climate diplomacy. He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India’s position at global platform. Before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, Vishwa had covered internal security and investigative agencies for more than a decade. Read More

title: Trump-Mamdani love-fest lights up US politics
content: the two political polar opposites from new york have just reunited and found they love Broadway and baseball . the meeting, which by Trump’s reckoning attracted more media interest than his international engage, attracted media interest . a brash billionaire with a penchant for gold-plated everything, the other a democratic socialist with silver tongue, swapped compliments, pledged cooperation, traded arm pats, and even shared chuckle .

title: Probe finds graft, bias in World University Games fiasco
content: The opening ceremony of the FISU World University Games Rhine-Ruhr 2025 was held on July 16 in Duisburg, Germany Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More

title: US warns western allies against mass migration saying it is an existential threat
content: the state department sought to expand the Trump administration’s anti-migration outlook beyond US borders . it instructed american embassies in western nations to report on the human rights implications and public safety impacts of mass migration . the u.s. said mass migration is a human rights concern affecting the population of its allies .

title: Mumbai twins, just a month old, battle drug-resistant TB
content: Malathy Iyer is Senior Editor (Health) at The Times of India, Mumbai. She writes mainly on health-related subjects.

title: Saudi bus crash: Umrah pilgrims, including 45 Indians laid to rest in Medina
content: Driven by curiosity and a human interest lens, Amisha is dedicated to impactful storytelling. She has navigated a wide range of beats over time, including environment, gender, youth affairs, heritage, and closely tracks the lives and migration of Indian diaspora. Her reporting has sparked public dialogue, with several stories cited in court proceedings and acted upon,  creating impact both locally and nationally. Read More

title: Tharoor's post on Trump-Mamdani meeting gives BJP ammo to attack Rahul
content: BJP spokesperson shehzad Poonawalla commended Tharoor for his remarks . he said he hoped that Rahul Gandhi would get the message . the pair adopted a warm tone during their first meeting at the white house .

title: Not pressured by trolls: Justice Kant ahead of taking oath as CJI
content: justice Surya Kant took oath as 53rd chief justice of india on saturday . he said he does not get pressured by social media trolls . many of them attempt to misrepresent, misquote or selectively extract court observations .

(@IAF_MCC on X) Sanjeev Verma is a Senior Assistant Editor covering Himachal Pradesh for The Times of India. His journalism experience spans across multiple states, including Punjab and Haryana, in addition to covering the Punjab and Haryana High Court, after an initial stint in Delhi. He navigates the realms of politics, security, public policy, finance, industries and commerce, rural development, legal affairs, environment, defence services welfare, and NRI affairs, with a focus on investigative journalism. title: G20 summit: PM Modi calls for global fight against drug-terror nexus

title: College Football Playoff picks after Week 13
content: the Oklahoma Sooners beat the Missouri Tigers 17-6 on saturday . OU's defense was all over the Tigers in a 17-6 win over a ranked opponent . the Sooners were ranked no. 8 in the CFP rankings .

title: Lavelle leads Gotham to 2nd NWSL title in 3 years
